item.title: SCOTUS Rejects Second Amendment Challenges To Maryland AR-15 Ban, Rhode Island Magazine Cap
item.description: ‘Our Constitution allows the American people — not the government — to decide which weapons are useful for self defense,’ Thomas dissented.

item.title: SCOTUS Agrees To Decide Case On Candidates’ Standing To Challenge Election Laws
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court agreed on Monday to take up a case involving questions surrounding federal candidate litigation of state election regulations. ...

item.title: False Promises: Sexual Liberation Hurts Us All
item.description: A new book details how the sexual revolution has backfired and has severely damaged Western society.

item.title: Why It’s Hard To Make Sense Of The ‘Mishmash’ In Republicans’ ‘Big, Beautiful Bill’
item.description: Even if the bill passes and gets signed into law, the policy muddle inside it will prove difficult to explain and defend.

item.title: An Intellectual Renaissance Starts With Memorizing The Words That Made America
item.description: Only by immersing ourselves in the best words of our forbears will we recover something of the culture that made these words possible in the first pla...
